html: (2 Nephi 24:1)."Strangers shall be joined with them." What "strangers" will join with the house of Jacob or the covenant people of Israel? We are reminded of the apostle Paul's declaration to the converts to Christ of his day: "Now therefore ye are no more strangers and foreigners, but fellowcitizens with the saints, and of the household of God." (Ephesians 2:19.) Furthermore, we think of the promise regarding the posterity of the great patriarch Abraham, grandfather of Jacob: "And if ye be Christ's, then are ye Abraham's seed, and heirs according to the promise." (Galatians 3:29.) By accepting the gospel, "There is neither Jew nor Greek [Gentile] … for ye are all one in Christ Jesus." (Galatians 3:28.)
